1{-# OPTIONS_GHC -Wall #-}
2
3-- | Relation type
4
5module Koshucode.Baala.Data.Type.Rel.Rel
6  ( -- * Data type
7    Rel (..), Body,
8    relSort, relBodyOrder,
9  
10    -- * Constant
11    reldum, reldee, reldau,
12
13    -- * Converter
14    SelectRel (..),
15    judgesFromRel,
16  ) where
17
18import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Overture              as O
19import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Base                  as B
20import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Syntax                as S
21import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Data.Type.Rel.Head    as D
22import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Data.Type.Judge       as D
23import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Data.Type.JudgeClass  as D
24
25
26-- ----------------------  Data
27
28-- | Relations on type `c`.
29--   Relation is consist of heading and body.
30--   Body is thoretically a set of tuples,
31--   but implemented using list of list.
32data Rel c = Rel
33    { relHead :: D.Head       -- ^ Heading of relation
34    , relBody :: Body c    -- ^ Body of relation
35    } deriving (Show)
36
37-- | Body of relation, i.e., a list of tuples.
38--   Tuple is a list of contents.
39type Body c = [[c]]
40
41relPair :: Rel c -> (D.Head, Body c)
42relPair (Rel he bo) = (he, bo)
43
44-- This order is different from the order of relational lattice.
45instance (Ord c) => Ord (Rel c) where
46    compare r1 r2 = let r1' = relPair $ relSort r1
47                        r2' = relPair $ relSort r2
48                    in compare r1' r2'
49
50instance (Ord c) => Eq (Rel c) where
51    a == b = (compare a b == EQ)
52
53instance Functor Rel where
54    fmap f (Rel he bo) = let bo' = fmap f `fmap` bo
55                         in Rel he bo'
56
57instance D.GetTermNames (Rel c) where
58    getTermNames = D.getTermNames . relHead
59
60instance (B.MixShortEncode c) => B.MixShortEncode (Rel c) where
61    mixShortEncode sh (Rel he bo) =
62        let he'  = B.mixEncode he
63            bo'  = B.mixJoin1 $ map d bo
64            d xs = B.mixBracketS S.listOpen S.listClose $ mixBar xs
65        in B.mixBracketS S.relOpen S.relClose (he' `B.mixSep` bo')
66        where mixBar cs = B.mixJoinBar $ map (B.mixShortEncode sh) cs
67
68
69-- ----------------------  Sort contents
70
71-- | Sort head and body of relation.
72relSort :: (Ord c) => O.Map (Rel c)
73relSort = relSortBody . relSortHead
74
75-- | Sort head of relation.
76relSortHead :: O.Map (Rel c)
77relSortHead (Rel he bo) = Rel he' bo' where
78    he' = D.headMap B.sort he
79    bo' = D.bodyForward he' he bo
80
81-- | Sort body of relation.
82relSortBody :: (Ord c) => O.Map (Rel c)
83relSortBody (Rel he bo) = Rel he (B.sort $ B.unique bo)
84
85-- | Sort relation body according to order specification.
86relBodyOrder :: (Ord c) => [S.SignedTermName] -> D.Head -> O.Map [[c]]
87relBodyOrder ns he = ed where
88    ed    = B.sortByName ords $ D.getTermNames he
89    ords  = map B.orderingCap ns
90
91
92
93-- ----------------------  Constant
94
95-- | The nullary empty relation.
96--   In other words, relational constant
97--   that has no terms and no tuples.
98--
99--   >>> B.doc (reldum :: Rel Bool)
100--   {= =}
101
102reldum :: Rel c
103reldum = Rel mempty []
104
105-- | The nullary full relation.
106--   In other words, relational constant
107--   that has no terms and the empty tuple.
108--
109--   >>> B.doc (reldee :: Rel Bool)
110--   {= [] =}
111
112reldee :: Rel c
113reldee = Rel mempty [[]]
114
115-- | The empty relation with all terms.
116--   This is fake.
117reldau :: Rel c
118reldau = Rel mempty []
119
120
121-- ----------------------  Converter
122
123-- | Type for having relations.
124class SelectRel r where
125    -- | Convert judges to relation.
126    selectRel :: r c -> D.JudgeClass -> [S.TermName] -> Rel c
127
128-- | Convert relation to list of judges.
129judgesFromRel :: D.JudgeOf c -> D.JudgeClass -> Rel c -> [D.Judge c]
130judgesFromRel judgeOf pat (Rel he bo) = map judge bo where
131    judge = judgeOf pat . zip names
132    names = D.getTermNames he
